verses.verse: over the half-tribe of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo the son of Zechariah; over Benjamin, Jaasiel the son of Abner;
over Dan, Azarel the son of Jeroham. These were the leaders of the tribes of Israel.

But David did not take the number of those twenty years old and under, because ((Deut. 6:3)) the LORD had said He would multiply Israel like the (Gen. 15:5; 22:17; 26:4; Ex. 32:13; Deut. 1:10) stars of the heavens.

Joab the son of Zeruiah began a census, but he did not finish, for (2 Sam. 24:12-15; 1 Chr. 21:1-7) wrath came upon Israel because of this census; nor was the number recorded in the account of the chronicles of King David.

(Other State Officials) And Azmaveth the son of Adiel was over the king’s treasuries; and Jehonathan the son of Uzziah was over the storehouses in the field, in the cities, in the villages, and in the fortresses.
Ezri the son of Chelub was over those who did the work of the field for tilling the ground.
And Shimei the Ramathite was over the vineyards, and Zabdi the Shiphmite was over the produce of the vineyards for the supply of wine.
Baal-Hanan the Gederite was over the olive trees and the sycamore trees that were in the lowlands, and Joash was over the store of oil.
And Shitrai the Sharonite was over the herds that fed in Sharon, and Shaphat the son of Adlai was over the herds that were in the valleys.
Obil the Ishmaelite was over the camels, Jehdeiah the Meronothite was over the donkeys,
and Jaziz the (1 Chr. 5:10) Hagrite was over the flocks. All these were the officials over King David’s property.
Also Jehonathan, David’s uncle, was a counselor, a wise man, and a scribe; and Jehiel the son of Hachmoni was with the king’s sons.
(2 Sam. 15:12) Ahithophel was the king’s counselor, and (2 Sam. 15:32-37) Hushai the Archite was the king’s companion.
After Ahithophel was Jehoiada the son of Benaiah, then (1 Kin. 1:7) Abiathar. And the general of the king’s army was (1 Chr. 11:6) Joab.

(Solomon Instructed to Build the Temple) Now David assembled at Jerusalem all (1 Chr. 27:16) the leaders of Israel: the officers of the tribes and (1 Chr. 27:1, 2) the captains of the divisions who served the king, the captains over thousands and captains over hundreds, and (1 Chr. 27:25) the stewards over all the substance and possessions of the king and of his sons, with the officials, the valiant men, and all (2 Sam. 23:8-39; 1 Chr. 11:10-47) the mighty men of valor.

Then King David rose to his feet and said, “Hear me, my brethren and my people: (2 Sam. 7:2) I had it in my heart to build a house of rest for the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and for (Ps. 99:5; 132:7; (Is. 66:1)) the footstool of our God, and had made preparations to build it.
But God said to me, (2 Sam. 7:5, 13; 1 Kin. 5:3) ‘You shall not build a house for My name, because you have been a man of war and have shed ((1 Chr. 17:4; 22:8)) blood.’

However the LORD God of Israel (1 Sam. 16:6-13) chose me above all the house of my father to be king over Israel forever, for He has chosen (Gen. 49:8-10; 1 Chr. 5:2; Ps. 60:7) Judah to be the ruler. And of the house of Judah, (1 Sam. 16:1) the house of my father, and (1 Sam. 13:14; 16:12, 13; Acts 13:22) among the sons of my father, He was pleased with me to make me king over all Israel.
(1 Chr. 3:1-9; 14:3-7; 23:1) And of all my sons (for the LORD has given me many sons) (1 Chr. 22:9; 29:1) He has chosen my son Solomon to sit on the throne of the kingdom of the LORD over Israel.

Now He said to me, ‘It is (2 Sam. 7:13, 14; 1 Kin. 6:38; 1 Chr. 22:9, 10; 2 Chr. 1:9; 6:2) your son Solomon who shall build My house and My courts; for I have chosen him to be My son, and I will be his Father.
Moreover I will establish his kingdom forever, (1 Chr. 22:13) if he is steadfast to observe My commandments and My judgments, as it is this day.’
